p: Small islands are already being affected by climate change (CC): morbidity and mortality are a consequence of extreme weather events, as well as vector- and food- and water-borne diseases ( Nurse et al., 2014). Those extreme weather events refer to tropical cyclones, storm surges, flooding, and droughts leading to effects on human health, including drowning, injuries, disease transmission, and health effects derived from poor water quality (Nurse et al., Op.cit.).
